alert.note: Alert for St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 17 at 6:26PM EDT until June 17 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN ST. MARYS COUNTY... At 625 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Saint George Island, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...A wind gust to 58 mph was measured at Cobb Point Buoy. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Piney Point, Tall Timbers, Saint Inigoes Creek, Saint George Island, Saint Marys River, Point Lookout, Dameron, Drayden, Scotland, Saint Inigoes and Ridge. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
